reviews.review_msg: she is an expert in phonetics. her notes are in details. however. wanna get a higher grade in her class is not easy. she can deduct your mark from small mistakes. but she is a easy going person. you can argue some points back .

Super nice prof and always asks if anyone needs clarification. Assignments are much harder than the exams (she does this on purpose). Make sure you keep up with the material because there are pop quizzes, but they don't influence your grade too much. She really wants you to succeed in the class and goes at a very reasonable pace. Take her class!

Nice guy. But he not a good prof. He explains thing in a that only he can understand and expects you to understand. Very lazy as well because he uses other school and profs works.Few of our assignments says 'UBC LING' assignment.

his lecture notes are just not enough for students to understand all the materials well. homework are really really hard. his answer keys or hint are just too long to read and feeling not useful at all. He is poor in explaining students' questions. materials are too hard to understand as a 200 level course, he even cannot explain well too.

John is an okay professor. Just fine. Hes a nice guy and genuinely listens to the class and teaches at a good pace for the learning capabilities of the students. Charisma isnt his strongest attribute but if you work hard your work will pay off. I didnt originally plan on taking this course with him but he was alright.

Class's mostly lecture, with last 30-40 minutes spent practicing what we just learned / doing related exercises. Tests were all m/c, and quizzes are long answers, but neither were particularly hard as long as you've taken a LING course before. Would not recommend him for people who've never taken LING before, since he doesn't simplify things enough
he is a nice person but his lectures are quite boring, he sometimes doesnt know what he is teaching about and cant answer students questions
Good prof.

He's wonderful.  I've never had another prof who is as engaged and engaging as Prof Sosa.  His class made me want to do more phonetics, but I've found, in upper level courses, that nothing and no one else can equal his interest and enthusiasm.

In my four years at SFU, this is the only class that I've attended every single lecture.   (Not even swine flu kept me away!) I love Dr. Sosa. He's extremely knowledgeable, funny, engaging, and has a very pleasant speaking voice(Venezuelan, educated in Britain).  His class changed the way I look at spoken language. I would recommend him forever. <3

he seems to be very interesting and entertaining during class but his midterms are hardcore. also, the way he grades and unfair and he doesn't give you a chance to rechange your marks because he doesn't believe in the textbook answers.

He is one of the best professors in teaching phonology, he is so interested in this particular area. Exams were not hard, he really gives marks, always go to his office and ask questions, he is so helpful. He is a GREAT person.
No Comments

I seriously hope the faculty of Lingustic department would consider fire some of the useless profssors at SFU.  Just because they have been teaching at SFU for a long time does not mean they can teach at all.. This is the worst course taken at SFU ever.

Sosa is a very amusing prof, in the way that he can always bring a smile to your face. However you are never given enough time for the exams & they always have irrelevent ?'s on them. If you go to his office hrs he will go out of his way to help you.
The worst prof. in the whole ling. department.  Not helpful AT ALL!!!!  Play favorites...... don't know how to teach.

Sosa makes a simple class exceedingly unclear, then expects you to write the textbook for your exams. Exams were based more on memorization of his unclear theories than on problem solving. Worst linguistics prof at SFU. Sorry Sosa.

He expects the students to know a lot already about phonetics and phonology. Not very helpful during office hours because he replies a question with another question. I definitely self-taught 80% of the course and go to class for his examples.
Her class is REALLY DIFFICULT, I don't recommend this class. She's not helpful outside of class. If I need help, I'm asked to ask other students. The content is very hard.

Nice guy, and definitely knows his stuff, but the fact that it was his first time teaching the class was obvious. Didn't have much of an idea what level people were at. Different materials specified different conventions, which is 50% of phonetics. Very responsive to respectful feedback, as he is aware of need to smooth off the rough edges.
He's a really cool guy but his marking scheme is waaaay off. Expects us to know a lot more than we think we should. Group quizzes are easy but the midterm and assignments can be a bit tough.

Before 221 I didn't really like phonology at all but she rubbed off on me. She wants us to learn so the way she teaches is based on real knowledge and simplified (but not dumbed down) so that we can easily understand it. She's available for extra help, she's accessible and she wants to know the students. If only all profs were like her...
exm hard..always no time to finish..and think about questions...
he's good, but he's not easy at all! if u care about ur GPA he's not the option... o_o
Lovely and kinda cute. He makes a lot of improvement in his course. The best professor in SFU!!

I worried about the course when I registered it because his rating was so low here. Now, it's almost the end of the semaster, I can say he's one of the best teacher I've ever had. He respects student and give student chances to pull up their marks. he always answers student questions with a BIG SMIL
Kinda boring.
he's smart but he doesn't realize he is not delivering his messages properly. horrible lectures, midterms are ok if u memorize the whole book, hard marker
No Comments
No Comments
NEVER TAKE HIS CLASS (or else you will regret it)
Very Uninformative. Incoherent explanations to questions.
Exams were VERY difficult!  His lecture notes were not helpful at all!!  The text was unclear AND VERY technical.  If there is another prof teaching this, take the alternative.
woah what a class, i dont think ive ever fluked out in a class ever as that one, thank goodness for his scale!
His Midterm was soo hard...too many quetions to do ....

Marion loves group work, which can be helpful or frustrating, depending on what kind of group you get into. Marion also loves being really sarcastic, which isn't for everyone. She's very much got the cheeky linguistic mum thing down. Marion's grading is fair, and she seems open to constructive criticism. I just don't think I'd take her again.

Her teaching speed was fast and her lecture slides were not well-organized. There were quizzes for next week's materials. She makes you to read the textbook. I felt more confused after attending the lectures. If there were no group exams, my scores would be even lower.

She is very funny, helpful, and intelligent. Her explanation is clear! But content may be difficult. Keep up with materials. Then you'll be fine! Also, don't worry, Dr. Caldecott doesn't scale down. So your grade will be a bit higher than expected!! :)

Pay attention to marking, you will likely have to argue for marks as Dr. Caldecott uses a marker for most things; the marking was frequently unclear and not without errors, ie. things were sometime marked wrong that should not have been. Dr. Caldecott is an enthusiastic instructor but moves quickly through material.

Marion is a wonderful teacher, she is super helpful and will always make time if you don't understand something. This isn't an easy course though, if you want to get a good mark you will have to work hard.

She's a nice teacher but strict. She's fair at marking but has ways to make you read the textbook. She can tell if you haven't read it b/c she'll answer your questions with a question that's suppose to "lead" you to the answer. She's nice, but exams are toughies. No final. i bombed the 2nd midterm and got a B :)
